lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Lara.ui.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Lara.ui.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Lara is your best friend; itâ€™s the task manager chatbot that keeps track of your tasks. It is also:
3. Add Events: `event description /from DD/MM/YYYY HHMM /to DD/MM/YYYY HHMM `
The `list` command displays a list of the tasks currently stored.
You can mark a task as done.
Mistakenly marked a task as done? Not to fret, you can also mark a task as not done yet.
Deletes the task stored at that number.
Find your tasks with a specific keyword!
Sorts by start dates of deadlines and events in chronological order. After this, you can use the list command to see the list of sorted tasks!
Lists out all the commands used in the chatbot and the exact format.

The `bye` command saves all your tasks and exits the chatbot. You can also manually close the chatbot by clicking the cross in the top left corner. The next time you reopen the chatbot, your tasks will be waiting for you.

* Task is an abstract class representing a generic task.
* Subclasses include Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* - isDone: Status indicating if the task is completed.
* - markAsDone(): Marks the task as completed.
* - toString(): Returns a string representation of the task.
